isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Rear Cover - Removal - Rear Main Seal and Wear Sleeve

svcproc.title: Rear Main Seal and Wear Sleeve

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields when performing the following procedure. See "Safety Information."

step1.para: Use an awl or 1/8 inch drill bit to make two small starter holes approximately 180° apart in rear main seal.

figure.caption: Removing the rear main oil seal (CF)

step1.para: Thread slide hammer screw into one of the starter holes. To remove seal evenly, use slide hammer on one side then alternate to other side.
Remove and discard rear main oil seal.

note.para: When removing the rear main oil seal, it should be noted that production engines not previously serviced, will not have a wear sleeve. Wear sleeves are only available as a service item included with the rear main oil seal service kit.

figure.caption: Installing the Rear / Wear Sleeve Removal Tool (CF)

step1.para: Install the Rear / Wear Sleeve Removal Tool (tri-shell components).
Install the Rear / Wear Sleeve Removal Tool (outer ring component). Make sure wear sleeve removal tool shells are securely in place behind wear sleeve prior to applying any force to threaded shaft.
Thread puller shaft tool in and remove wear sleeve.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields when performing the following procedure. See "Safety Information."

step1.para: Use an awl or 1/8 inch drill bit to make two small starter holes approximately 180° apart in rear main seal.

figure.caption: Removing the rear main oil seal (stripped chassis)

step1.para: Thread slide hammer screw into one of the starter holes. To remove seal evenly, use slide hammer on one side then alternate to other side.
Remove and discard rear main oil seal.

note.para: When replacing the rear main seal, please note that production engines will not have a wear sleeve. Wear sleeves are only available as a service item included with the replacement rear main oil seal.

step1.para: Install the Rear / Wear Sleeve Removal Tool (tri-shell components) around the wear sleeve.
Install the Rear / Wear Sleeve Removal Tool (outer ring component). Make sure wear sleeve removal tool shells are securely in place behind wear sleeve prior to applying any force to threaded shaft.
Turn the threaded shaft clockwise until the wear sleeve is free of the crankshaft flange.
